description:
Turnover tax on supplies and services

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
73311 Turnover tax statistics (advance returns)
73321 Turnover tax statistics (assessments)

Definition:
Applying the tax rates to the assessment basis for supplies
and services provides the turnover tax on supplies and
services. There is a special regulation for turnover
achieved by agricultural or forestry holdings in accordance
with Section 24 (1) of the Turnover Tax Law.

Turnover is measured as follows:
- for supplies and other services, it is generally measured
by the remuneration (Section 10 (1) of the Turnover Tax
Law),
- for own consumption as defined in Section 3 (1b) of the
Turnover Tax Law, it is measured by the purchase price
plus incidental expenses or, in the absence of a purchase
price, by the cost price (Section 10 (4) of the Turnover
Tax Law),
- for travel services as defined in Section 25 (1) of the
Turnover Tax Law, it is measured by the difference between
the amount spent by the customer and the amount spent by
the entrepreneur on intermediate consumption (Section 25
(3) of the Turnover Tax Law - margin scheme),
- for turnover regarding movable tangible property, it is
measured - under certain conditions - by the amount by
which the selling price exceeds the purchase price
(Section 25a (3) of the Turnover Tax Law - margin scheme).

The turnover tax which, in accordance with Section 10 (4),
second sentence of the Turnover Tax Law, is not part of the
assessment basis should always be calculated on the basis of
the remuneration agreed upon (accrual accounting) (Section
16 (1) of the Turnover Tax Law). Tax calculation by
remuneration received (cash accounting) is limited to
enterprises with a total turnover of not more than 500,000
euros in the previous year (from 1 September 2009), to those
not obliged to keep accounts and to those belonging to the
liberal professions (Section 20 of the Turnover Tax Law).

Since 1 July 2007, the turnover tax has amounted to 19
percent of the assessment basis for any taxable turnover
(Section 12 (1) of the Turnover Tax Law); for a number of
turnover types it is reduced to 7 percent (Section 12 (2) of
the Turnover Tax Law), among other things, for the supply,
importation, intra-Community acquisition and letting of the
items listed in the Annex to the Turnover Tax Law (e.g.
agricultural and forestry products, food, printed books,
newspapers, pictures and other products of the printing
industry, manuscripts, typescripts and plans, specific
appliances for sick people, art objects); the reduced tax
rate also applies to specific services in the cultural area
and to short-distance passenger transport in accordance with
Section 12 (2), number 10 of the Turnover Tax Law.
